properties.Title: Update To Civil Emergency Alert Issued By Government Of Saskatchewan
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Civil Emergency Alert issued by the Government of Saskatchewan. The state of emergency in Saskatchewan remains in effect. UPDATE: Phase 2 of Re-Open Saskatchewan is effective May 19, 2020. All Public Health Orders continue to apply during the implementation of Phase 2 Re-Open Saskatchewan. People are being reminded to avoid unnecessary travel and stay home if you are sick or symptomatic. Public and private gatherings, inside and outside, are limited to more no more than 10 people and physical distancing by at least two metres from others is to be applied. Monitor and follow all public health orders on the Saskatchewan.ca COVID 19 website. Wash your hands often. Together, we are reducing the risk. We can pull together by staying apart.
Expires: 2020-05-25T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-19T16:41:35-06:00, 3EA4278A-7E10-0E3D-2DB2-71CB93B8F62A
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. Please call HealthLine 811 for advice on health risks, symptoms and precautions associated with air quality. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-05-21T07:29:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-20T15:29:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3386688314.2020

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. STrong northwesterly winds combined with falling snow will bring blizzard conditions to the Naujaat region tonight and Thursday. A disturbance tracking across the Foxe Basin is currently bringing moderate northwesterly winds to the Naujaat region with occasional poor visibilities in blowing snow. Winds are expected to intensify tonight and this along with falling snow will create blizzard conditions which will persist into Thursday. Conditions are expected to improve Thursday night as winds diminish. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-21T06:30:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-20T14:31:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1297569777.2020
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Severe winds this morning in Coral Harbour. A potent winter storm crossing Hudson Bay has brought severe northerly winds of 70 gusting 90 km/h to the community. These severe winds will last until later this morning when they ease slightly to near 50-60 km/h. Moderate to strong northerly winds will continue into Thursday. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-20T19:00:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-20T12:16:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0346631602.2020
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Snow and strong northerly winds are expected to result in blizzard conditions in the Sanirajak (Hall Beach) region beginning Wednesday morning. These blizzard conditions will likely persist into Wednesday night before improving Thursday morning. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-21T00:40:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-20T08:41:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3592498452.2020
Area: Hall Beach
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Heavy snow expected in Pangnirtung Wednesday into Wednesday night. Heavy snow will move into the Pangnirtung region Wednesday morning and continue into Wednesday night. Total snowfall accumulations of 15 to 25 cm are possible by Thursday morning. Periods of light snow may persist in the region on Thursday however no further significant accumulation are expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-21T00:38:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-20T08:39:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2948840216.2020
Area: Pangnirtung
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Wind gusts up to 100 km/h are expected overnight tonight and Wednesday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Severe westerly winds will develop in the Kinngait region today. Winds will shift to the west in Kinngait later this morning and strengthen into the 70 to 80 km/h range with gusts potentially exceeding 100 km/h. These severe winds will persist into the evening and then ease slightly to 60 gusting 80 km/h for Wednesday night and Thursday. Visibilities may be reduced in blowing snow at times. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-21T00:36:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-20T08:37:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2458679287.2020
Area: Cape Dorset
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. A low pressure system tracking through Hudson Bay will bring a wintery mix of weather to communities in southern Baffin Island today. Freezing rain moved into Iqaluit early this morning and persist for a few hours before temperatures climb above freezing. The precipitation may be mixed with snow at times. Please refer to the public forecast for additional details. ### Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-20T19:59:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-20T14:20:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2460076061.2020
Area: Iqaluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada
